skill.name: research-lookup
skill.description: Look up current research information using Perplexity's Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro models through OpenRouter. Automatically selects the best model based on query complexity. Search academic papers, recent studies, technical documentation, and general research information with citations.
skill.summary: Look up current research information using Perplexity's Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro mode...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Reviewed 4 text files with 1178 lines. The code uses a user provided OpenRouter API key to call Perplexity models and formats responses with citations. No data theft, obfuscation, or malicious execution patterns found.

content.user_title: Find recent research with smart model selection
content.value_statement: Research information is scattered across papers and databases. This skill searches with citations and picks the best model for your query depth.
actual_capabilities: Selects Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro based on query complexity rules
Sends scholarly focused queries to OpenRouter Perplexity models
Extracts citations from API search results and legacy citation fields
Finds DOI and source URLs in response text as a fallback
Runs batch queries with optional delay for rate limiting
Provides a CLI for single queries and model info
limitations: Results depend on OpenRouter availability and model indexing
Paywalled sources may be cited without full text access
Responses are limited by model coverage and prompt clarity

use_cases.title: Literature review sprint
use_cases.description: Collect recent papers and citations for a thesis chapter quickly.

use_cases.title: Protocol verification
use_cases.description: Verify methods and parameters against recent technical sources.

use_cases.title: Evidence backed drafting
use_cases.description: Gather sources and summaries to support an article draft.

prompt_templates.title: Quick paper lookup
prompt_templates.scenario: Find recent papers on a topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Find recent papers on CRISPR off target effects from 2022 to 2024 with citations and short summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Method check
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize current Western blot protocol best practices and include key papers with DOI links.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare transformer models and RNNs for sequence modeling and cite recent review papers.

prompt_templates.title: Deep synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how mRNA vaccines trigger immune responses and cite primary studies from 2021 onward.

output_examples.input: Summarize recent studies on AI in radiology and cite key papers.
output: Summary of 3 to 5 recent studies on AI in radiology
Key findings and reported performance metrics
Citations with authors, year, and DOI or source links

best_practices: Use specific topics, time frames, and information types in queries
Start with automatic model selection before forcing a model
Verify critical claims against primary sources
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts like latest news or tell me about AI
Assuming paywalled full text access is available
Skipping citation verification for high impact claims

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, it is designed for Claude Code and works in Codex style CLI flows.

faq.question: What limits does the skill have?
faq.answer: Results depend on model coverage, indexing, and OpenRouter availability.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into batch workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, it supports batch queries with an optional delay parameter.

faq.question: Does it send my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it only sends your query and uses the OpenRouter API key you provide.

faq.question: What should I do if I get an API error?
faq.answer: Check your OPENROUTER_API_KEY, quota, and network access settings.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generic web search?
faq.answer: It prioritizes scholarly sources and provides structured citations.
